description: Numbers n such that 13^n - 12^n is prime.
comments: Terms greater than 1000 may correspond to (unproven) strong pseudoprimes 13^n - 12^n. [Clarified by _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 16 2013]
author: _Mike Oakes_, May 18 2001, May 19 2001
extensions: Two more terms 30271 and 87557 found by Jean-Louis Charton in 2007 and 2008 corresponding to probable primes with 33721 and 97534 digits. _Jean-Louis Charton_, Sep 02 2009
